choices.answer: A combination of ones social, mental and physical health.
Mental, social, physical, spiritual and emotional wellbeing.
A measure of our ability to perform daily tasks/activities.
Looking, feeling and doing our best.

questions.question: 'Range of movement possible at various joints' is which component of fitness?

choices.answer: Balance.
Flexibility.
Aerobic Capacity.
Reaction Time.

questions.question: What does the 'I' in the FIDT principle represent?

choices.answer: Individual.
Intelligence.
Intensity.
Independent.
Targets people set to achieve goals.
Excuses people use for not participating in exercise.
Qualities athletes must develop.
Formula for fitness when putting together a fitness program.

questions.question: When a person throws a shot put, what component of fitness are they using?

choices.answer: Muscular strength.
Muscular power.
Muscular endurance.
Flexibility.

questions.question: When a person runs a marathon, what component of fitness are they using?

choices.answer: Speed.
Aerobic capacity.
Balance.
Reaction time.
